title: Adding HCl and NaOH to acetate buffer

content.question: A solution is prepared by mixing equal volumes of <math alttext="0.20 molar H C 2 H 3 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>H</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="0.40 molar N a C 2 H 3 O 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.40</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>Na</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly describes what occurs if a small amount of <math alttext="H C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> or <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is added?

choices.label: If <math alttext="H C l, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is added, the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase only slightly because the <math alttext="C l with a negative 1 charge " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions will react with <math alttext="C 2 H 3 O 2 with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> ions.

If <math alttext="H C l, aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is added, the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease only slightly because the <math alttext="H with a positive 1 charge " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions will react with <math alttext="C 2 H 3 O 2 with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> ions.

If <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is added, the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase only slightly because the <math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions will react with <math alttext="C 2 H 3 O 2 with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> ions.

If <math alttext="N a O H, aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is added, the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease only slightly because the <math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions will react with <math alttext="H C 2 H 3 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules.
